item.title: Non council tenent fly tipping, 13th December
item.description:
I was coming into my block of flats and noticed a van stopping at every bin at every block and taking rubbish out there van, I could not get a photo as was too late to get my phone out but I managed to get there registration plate: GY25CXS FORD TRANSIT
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Restons Crescent, Avery Hill

item.title: Fly tipping of household waste, 13th December
item.description:
You have marked this problem as fixed. IT IS NOT FIXED IT IS EXACTLY THE SAME AS WHEN I FIRST REPORTED IT. Please clear this fly tipping away as soon as possible.

item.title: Fly tupping Maddocks Close, 13th December
item.description:
Again rubbish dumped been there for day.s. It is a continuous issue near the L&Q flats. I have suggested a camera before but not got a response. This needs to be investigated and the people who do this need a hefty fine.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St George's Road, North Cray, Greater London

item.title: Parked cars causing an obstruction, 13th December
item.description:
Two parked were parked on either side of the road (where the are no restrictions) causing an obstruction, so other vehicles couldnt pass. This is dangerous if emergency service vehicles needed access and shouldn't be allowed to happen. Yellow lines are needed on one side.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Apple Grove, Southbury, Greater London

item.title: Area by bike bay is a state, 13th December
item.description:
The are around the Lime bike bays at the junction of Hansler Road and Lordship Lane is even worse than usual. Litter/fly tipping, 3 x abandoned green wheelie bins which seem to be a health hazard please leaves everywhere. It looks dreadful and is dangerous. Please sort it out. Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 133, Lordship Lane, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: CATV manhole cover sinking and broken pavement slabs, 13th December
item.description:
This CATV manhole cover was mended in August 2025 with sand - it is now sinking and is wobbly. It has been like this for a month, and is getting worse. Other covers on the same road are surrounded by concrete, instead of sand. Also, the pavement slabs around this cover are broken.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tewson Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
